content:
Hi there!

I've installed a self-hosted Zulip server, and am now installing and configuring some bots. I've managed to install and run the Wikipedia bot without any problems. I'm using the Zulip Botserver - with a botserverrc config file, as recommended, as I want to add several other bots. Many bots, however, require config values to be passed - e.g., API keys for various services, like Github, Gitlab, OpenWeatherMap, etc.

Is there a way to dynamically pass these configuration values to Botserver, via the botserverrc file? Or are we supposed to hard-code these values in the bot's .conf file? If so, where will those files be located on the server? - is it the one in /usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/zulip_bots?
Follow-up: I've worked it out. The config needs to be passed by setting up a separate "bot configuration' file - which we have to pass as an argument to the zulip-botserver command. Got it :+1:
@Lux Logica yeah, that's right! If you have thoughts for how we could improve this system or its docs to have made this clearer, please share them!

@Tim Abbott I did make some suggestions here. Indeed, for SysAdmins who just want to get bots installed and running, the docs are somewhat scattered, difficult to follow, and generally unfriendly - in contrast to the rest of the Zulip docs, which is excellent. Perhaps that's because the bots are still a 'beta' feature? I'm sure it'll improve.
@Lux Logica awesome, thanks for the feedback. I agree that section is much less polished; your feedback will help direct the concrete work to make it better.
